rComments: Very boring lectures and monotone voice. Midterm study guides are basically a table of contents (you're not sure what to know about the listed topics). Material is very dense so it's not easy. This class doesn't interest me at all (taking it only for the GE). Strongly would not recommend taking this class.

edwards' class was fairly easy. didn't use the book much. hw was mostly math but TA's arent tough graders and if you go to discussion they tell you how to do the work. gives optional midterm and final review sessions which do help. if you study, tests are manageable. great experience. field trip was great.

Edwards proved to be a very knowledgeable lecturer. As a non-major seeking the Q requirement I found the class to have enough qualitative information to keep me interested. It is math heavy (weekly homeworks, 40% of tests) but my TA was extremely helpful as was Edwards at his office hours. Overall is was a little dry, but a good way to get the Q.

Really put an effor to make the material accessible to mom-majors ( the people taking this for the Q)He had interactive experiments in class that made the class a bit mor interesting. He even held out of class review sessions before midterms which really helped!

Prof. Edwards is a good teacher and underrated on RMP.com. While somewhat monotone and not the most enthusiastic dude, his teaching methods are clear and comprehensive, supplementing the textbook in an informative way. Id imagine hes not too helpful out of class, but OCEANS01 is easy/interesting enough that he manages ok.

Lectures were understandable and organized. Sections were mandatory, hw packets were weekly but partly done as classwork in groups, so were doable. Final/midterm were reasonable if you actually study.  Beach fieldtrip was really interesting/fun!! Can earn A by attending lecture/section, taking notes, doing hw on time (do not need to read textbook).

Needlessly complicated lectures and math assignments which drained all salvageable interest left in this subject (from a non-major perspective). Most difficult/disappointing professor I have encountered at UCSC.

Prof. Edwards taught this introductory course as if it were an upper division class. Heavy math emphasis with packets of homework due each week (felt like high school homework/busywork). He was also very difficult to talk to and seems unable to relate to undergraduate students. Avoid at all costs.
